info.title: Tpay Open API
info.description:
Tpay API dedicated both for merchants and partners
# Authentication
# Marketplace Notifications
# Credit card payments

get.description: Fetch list of merchant's accounts
Get list of account categories

200.description: Get specified category by its ID

Get list of account MCCs

422.description: Blik alias does not fulfil one or more of the requirements.

200.description: Login to Partner API to obtain auth token

get.description: Allows to check active token information including expiration date

200.description: Returns information about the active token.

requestBody.description: Use this endpoint to create a new unpaid transaction. Call to /pay endpoint.

400.description: Returns information about invalid validation with list of errors.

get.description: Fetch details and status of given transaction

parameters.description: Returns additional payment attempts object. Useful for BLIK payments on-site integration

Create new refund for marketplace transaction

requestBody.description:
Use this endpoint to create a refund to booked transaction.
                The sum of refunds can not exceed the total transaction amount.

400.description: Returns information about invalid validation with list of errors.

404|405.description: Transaction is not paid or amount is invalid

400.description: Returns information about invalid validation with list of errors.

get.description: Fetch list of transactions

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Date and time in format yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Date and time in format yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss

post.description: Generate QR code containing redirection to paywall for given transaction

requestBody.description: Generates QR code containing redirection to paywall for given transaction.

post.description: Submit payment details for transaction (for selected payment methods)

get.description: Fetch given transaction details and status

200.description: Get specified transaction by its ID

get.description: Fetch list of refunds for given transaction

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Date and time in format yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Date and time in format yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss

200.description: Get a list of refunds for the transaction.

post.description: Request refund for given transaction in full or partial amount

requestBody.description:
Refund allows to return a full or partial amount of the transaction. 
                It will be processed in a currency in which transaction was paid.
                After a successful refund,
                a list of requested returns will be returned with a related transaction object.
                NOTICE: transactionId can be obtained from POST /transactions response.
                
                Refund full transaction amount
                Request url: /transactions/ta_6UvbBjehvHXA7vfD/refunds
                or (depends on your transactionId format)
                Request url: /transactions/01K1Z6T40ZWKY1XZG9VD5AZ9Q4/refunds

                Request body: {}

200.description: Transaction object with a list of refunds.

get.description: Request cancellation of transaction

200.description: Cancel specified transaction by its ID

405.description: Method is not allowed for your account

200.description: Cancel specified transaction by its ID

405.description: Method is not allowed for your account

parameters.name: onlyOnline
parameters.description: If set to true will return only online payment groups.

get.description: Fetch list of available payment channels
Fetch list of refunds

parameters.name: payerEmail
parameters.description: Email of payer. Used only in 'transactional' context.

parameters.name: transactionTitle
parameters.description: Title of transaction. Used only in 'transactional' context.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Refunds context. Available values : transactional, card , Default value : transactional

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Card token. Used only in 'card' context.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Date and time in format yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss

parameters.description: Date and time in format yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss

requestBody.description: Data needed to initiate an Apple Pay session.

200.description: Information about response in boolean type.

400.description: Validation or initialize Apple Pay session error.

post.description: Request creation of new card token without processing payment

200.description: Information about response in boolean type.

get.description: Fetch details of previously established card token

delete.description: Request removal of previously established card token

204.description:
Token successfully validated and processed.
            The token removal process will be executed asynchronously.

description.description: Description of the permission asked, visible to the payer.

posId.description: Identifier of your POS which issued the alias request

date.description: List of timestamps of alias lifecycle events

description.description: Description of the alias, as it was presented to the payer.

currency.description: This parameter affects display language of payment wall and email notifications

description.description: Transaction description to display on payment wall

hiddenDescription.description:
Custom unique value assigned to the transaction ie. orderId.
        This value will be sent back in webhook notification after successful payment

languageCode.description: This parameter affects display language of payment wall and email notifications

preSelectedChannelId.description:
Id of payment channel chosen on merchant side. Null if there was no choice on merchant side.
        If this value is provided, a payer will see the specific payment wall step of selected payment method.
        If null, a payer will see the payment wall with choice of all available payment methods

title.description:
The user-friendly transaction title presented to
     * the payer

paymentUrl.description: The URL to payment wall of created transaction.

example.amount: This value should be of type int.
example.billingAddress.email: This value should not be blank.

currency.description: This parameter affects display language of payment wall and email notifications

description.description: Transaction description to display on payment wall

hiddenDescription.description:
Custom unique value assigned to the transaction ie. orderId.
        This value will be sent back in webhook notification after successful payment

languageCode.description: This parameter affects display language of payment wall and email notifications

preSelectedChannelId.description:
Id of payment channel chosen on merchant side. Null if there was no choice on merchant side.
        If this value is provided, a payer will see the specific payment wall step of selected payment method.
        If null, a payer will see the payment wall with choice of all available payment methods

applePayPaymentData.description:
Apple Pay Payment Data This is base64 of json containing encrypted payment data received from
            Apple Pay JS on payment authorized event

result.description:
success - all actions in the request are successful.
actionRequired - after this request you need to perform an action like redirect user to specific URL to finish the operation.
pending - all actions in the request are successful, but you need to wait for confirmation (action is asynchronous).
failed - request failed, validation went wrong, or action finished with declined status, look after errors section in response to see more information

status.description:
pending - transaction is waiting for being processed
paid - transaction is paid
correct - merchant has accepted payment
refund - transaction has been fully refunded
canceled - transaction has been marked as canceled

hiddenDescription.description: Parameter to identify the transaction on the merchant side.

childTransactions.description: Empty array to refund entire transaction payment or array of child transactions to refund

hiddenDescription.description: Parameter to identify the transaction on the merchant side.

logo.description: Base64 encoded image of logo to be embedded into QR code.

logoType.description: Type of logo image to be embedded into QR code

cof.description:
Credentials On File This option indicates type of card token payment. List of available options:
unscheduled - does not occur on a scheduled or regularly occurring transaction date, card charges initiated by merchant
cardholder_initiated - indicates that card charge is being processed with the intention of retaining the cardholders data
recurring - card charges initiated by merchant at regular fixed intervals

applePayPaymentData.description:
Apple Pay Payment Data This is base64 of json containing encrypted payment data received from
            Apple Pay JS on payment authorized event

success - all actions in the request are successful.

success - all actions in the request are successful.
failed - more details in errors section

List of available transaction statuses
        * success - all actions in the request are successful
        * actionRequired - after this request you need to perform an action like redirect user to specific 
          URL to finish the operation
        * pending - all actions in the request are successful, but you need to wait for 
          confirmation (action is asynchronous)
        * failed - request failed, validation went wrong, or action finished with declined status,
          look after errors section in response to see more information

tokenValue.description: Length should be one of 12-19 for EISOP.

cardExpiryDate.description: Card expiry date in YYMM format. Required with EISOP token.

rocText.description: Custom identificator for settlement. This value must be alphanumeric.

result.description:
List of available transaction statuses
success - all actions in the request are successful actionRequired - after this request you need to perform an action like redirect user to specific URL to finish the operation
pending - all actions in the request are successful, but you need to wait for confirmation (action is asynchronous)
failed - request failed, validation went wrong, or action finished with declined status,
look after errors section in response to see more information

List of available transaction statuses
* success - all actions in the request are successful
* actionRequired - after this request you need to perform an action like redirect user to specific URL to
finish the operation
* pending - all actions in the request are successful,
but you need to wait for confirmation (action is asynchronous)
* failed - request failed, validation went wrong, or action finished with declined status,
look after errors section in response to see more information

status.description:
Available refund status for 'transactional' context
* new - fresh refund
* pending - awaiting refund to process
* to_complete - refund is awaiting for payer data completion (missing bank account)
* cancel - aborted refund, will not be porcessed
* hold - refund temporary aborted, will be processed after verification process
* processed - refund processed, but not done (awaiting for send to payer)
* done - refund done, money has ben sent

Available refund status for 'card' context

* new - fresh refund
* declined - refund declined by acquirer
* authorized - refund done

domainName.description: Correct domain name provided during boarding.

displayName.description:
Name displayed when paying. If it is not given,
            the name is taken from the data provided during boarding.

validationUrl.description:
Correct domain name provided during boarding.   
            The URL that is required to obtain an Apple Pay session.
            More information can be found:
            https://developer.apple.com/documentation/apple_pay_on_the_web/applepayvalidatemerchantevent/1778026-validationurl

result.description:
List of available transaction statuses:
            * success - all actions in the request are successful
            * actionRequired - after this request you need to perform an action like redirect user to specific URL 
            to finish the operation
            * pending - all actions in the request are successful, but you need to wait 
            for confirmation (action is asynchronous)
            * failed - request failed, validation went wrong, or action finished with declined status,
            look after errors section in response to see more information

callbackUrl.description: Url used to notification about ending tokenization process

result.description:
List of available transaction statuses
success - all actions in the request are successful actionRequired - after this request you need to perform an action like redirect user to specific URL to finish the operation
pending - all actions in the request are successful, but you need to wait for confirmation (action is asynchronous)
failed - request failed, validation went wrong, or action finished with declined status,
look after errors section in response to see more information

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the token

cardTail.description:
A masked card number containing the Bank Identification Number (BIN) 
        and the last four digits of the card

accountType.title: phpcs:disable.
accountType.description: 1 - polish (we only accept PLN currency), 2 - SEPA (we only accept EUR currency), 3 - foreign (we accept PLN, EUR, USD, GBP currencies)

id.description: Point Of Sale - this must be an active, verified POS added to requester account. The value is represented by ULID encoded to base32 format. To check your POS ID call the /accounts/pos API endpoint

amount.description:
Value in pennies ie. 123.45PLN should be passed as int: 12345. 
        The sum of child transactions equals the total transaction value. Minimum one child transaction is required.

hiddenDescription.description: An optional custom value from merchant system.

type.description: 1: Payer redirect url in success case, 2: Payer redirect url in error case, 3: POST notification url after successful payment, 4: Merchant notification email

amount.description:
Value in pennies ie. 123.45PLN should be passed as int: 12345. The sum of child transactions 
                      equals the total transaction value. Minimum one child transaction is required.

errorMessage.example: POS ID does not match a required format (e.g. ps_6UvbBjehvHXA7vfD)

devMessage.example: Provided POS id does not satisfy regexp /ps_[a-zA-Z0-9]{16}/

blikToken.description:
6 digit code generated in customer bank mobile app (required if customer does not have
            registered alias or when customer does not want to pay by registered device).

type.description:
Transaction type. List of available options:
0 - WEB mode
1 - POS mode dedicated for payment terminals
2 - Autopayment with only an alias, you need to register one first, see aliases field.

refuseNoPayId.description: Request transaction to be refused if bank doesn't support recurring payments

save.description: Defines if card data must be saved for future use.

rocText.description: Custom identificator for settlement. This value must be alphanumeric.

id.description: Child transaction id (either this or merchant id must be provided)

merchantId.description: Child transaction Merchant Id (either this or child transaction id must be provided)

tokenValue.description: Length should be one of 12-19 for EISOP.

cardExpiryDate.description: Card expiry date in YYMM format

initialTransactionId.description: Id of the initial transaction. This value corresponds to Elavon's Card Scheme Data

rocText.description: Custom identificator for settlement. This value must be alphanumeric.

status.description:
Available refund status for 'transactional' context

        * new - fresh refund
        * pending - awaiting refund to process
        * to_complete - refund is awaiting for payer data completion (missing bank account)
        * cancel - aborted refund, will not be porcessed
        * hold - refund temporary aborted, will be processed after verification process
        * processed - refund processed, but not done (awaiting for send to payer)
        * done - refund done, money has ben sent
        
        Available refund status for 'card' context

        * new - fresh refund
        * declined - refund declined by acquirer
        * authorized - refund done

availablePaymentChannels.description: List of channels IDs for future use

mainChannel.description: Main channel ID for future use

errorCode.description: Error code represents specific error id.

errorMessage.example: Selected refund could not be found. Ensure that it wasn't removed.

devMessage.description: Information on how developers can solve the issue.
devMessage.example: Refund couldn't be found. It might not exist, belong to a different Merchant or has been removed.

docUrl.description: URL to the information about the error code reported.

success.description: Url used to redirect payer after successful tokenization process

error.description: Url used to redirect payer after unsuccessful tokenization process

blikToken.description:
6 digit code generated in customer bank mobile app (required if customer does not have
            registered alias or when customer does not want to pay by registered device).

type.description:
Transaction type. List of available options:
0 - WEB mode
1 - POS mode dedicated for payment terminals
2 - Autopayment with only an alias, you need to register one first, see aliases field.

refuseNoPayId.description: Request transaction to be refused if bank doesn't support recurring payments

id.description: One of the merchant Ids taking part in the main transaction represented by ULID encoded in base32

name.description: Name of the product for easy differentiation by humans

externalId.description: Identifier of the product for easy differentiation by computers, eg. SKU

quantity.description: Quantity expressed as a floating-point number or a numeric string

unitPrice.description: Value of 1 unit of quantity in pennies

amount.description:
Value in pennies ie. 123.45PLN should be passed as int: 12345. The sum of child transactions 
                      equals the total transaction value. Minimum one child transaction is required.

paymentErrorCode.description:
Error code if any occurred. Null if payment was successful.
        See BLIK error codes for more details.

value.description: Alias generated in merchant system (unique for each customer)

label.description: How the alias will be shown in the payer's banking app
label.example: YourGroceryShop, the best shop for your grocery needs

key.description: Alias key (returned by api call with error ERR82) in case of using non-unique alias.

autopayment.description: For PAYID aliases, a specification of how alias will be used - dates, amounts, frequency

noDelay.description:
Skip 72h period during which bank attempts to 
            inform the user about the reason for the lack of authorization. Available for Model A and O.

errorMessage.example: Podany kod jest nieprawidowy, bd utraci wano

success.description: Address to redirect used when payment was successful.

error.description: Address to redirect used when errors occurred during payment process.

url.description: Result url for POST system notification

email.description: Merchant email addresses used to send notification when payment is finished.

value.description: Alias generated in merchant system (unique for each customer)

label.description: How the alias will be shown in the payer's banking app
label.example: YourGroceryShop, the best shop for your grocery needs

autopayment.description: For PAYID aliases, a specification of how alias will be used - dates, amounts, frequency

model.description: Blik recursive payments model, A, M or O

frequency.description: Model A: Frequency of payments in days, weeks, months or years

singleLimitAmount.description: Limit of a single payment's amount, in main unit of currency

totalLimitAmount.description: Limit of total amount on all payments' made with this alias, in main unit of currency

currency.description: Currency in which limits are given. Currently supported: PLN.

initDate.description: The date on which the alias will first be used

expirationDate.description: The date on which the alias will expire
